}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "P/N:F5-610007-43 REV:", "MADE IN TAIWAN R.O.C", and "1284022C" is silkscreened on the mainboard of the noted unit. A date code of '''0021''' is etched onto the bottom.
"A/N:"<......>"S5-PA5", "P/N:"<....>"Rev. PA", and "START: 2000/5/3" is silkscreened on the switch board.
The device populating this entry is presumed to be a v1 - it has no revision information on its label. .. however, [https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=3870 it would appear there would] be some differences between v1 units ([[Altima]] vs AMD PHYs) This is presumably a later revision v1.
This device has a seperate board for the S3C4510 router portion and the FE switch.
The switch board is certainly manufactured by '''Runtop''' (a label to the board seems to indicate it is model ARS5 - a '''Runtop''' label w/ ARS5 printed on it is also affixed to the casing [along with another of a different style..) The router board may also be (or instead, ''[[BroMax]]'' / ''[[CyberTAN]]''??)
{{seealso|Linksys BEFSR41 series}}
